interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/10/21
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Favreau'], 'Producers': ['Jon Favreau', 'Sergei Bespalov'], 'Starring': ['Jon Favreau', 'Sofia Vergara', 'John Leguizamo'], 'Studio': ['Open Road Films']}
Review Text: I enjoyed the characters, plot, and various messages in the film.  For some reason, the food inspired my mouth to water, my appetite to rage into Hulk like proportions, and my notes to self to find the best Cuban sandwiches in the area and visit tomorrow.  I am not usually influenced by food shows, but boy, honey, this little flick was uplifting and a great brief introduction into what really matters in life.. Love, family, friends, passion for your calling, and how your mind can be teased into torturing your appetite.  The only important person not raped was God.  Warning about a lot of cursing and some sexual discussions.
Review Title: Romance for the Taste Buds
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Alpha House
Comedy, Drama
["An Amazon Original series: They work in the Senate. They live in the house - Alpha House. Created by Garry Trudeau (Doonesbury, Tanner '88)."]

I do not like politics in real life.  But this clever show makes me laugh because I think it might be closer to the truth than politicians will admit.
Funny pokes at politics
Justified
Suspense, Western, Drama, Action
["Deputy US Marshal Raylan Givens (Timothy Olyphant) will start to pick at the thread of a cold case over 30 years in the making, unraveling a riddle that echoes all the way back to his boyhood and his criminal father's bad dealings. Meanwhile, Boyd Crowder (Walton Goggins) finds his grip on Harlan loosening due to a Pentecostal preacher with a penchant for theatrics and a knack for manipulation..."]

Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Fred Golan', 'Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard']}
I enjoy westerners.  Justified is a modern day cowboy tale.  Even some of the bad guys are loveable and others are just plain fun to hate.  Every once in awhile, I find myself boo and hissing at events.
love the modern day cowboy
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Starzak', 'Christopher Sadler', 'Jay Grace', 'Lee Wilton', 'Seamus Malone', 'Jean-Philippe Vine', 'Richard Webber', 'Will Becher', 'Mike Mort', 'Dave Osmand'], 'Starring': ['John Sparkes', 'Justin Fletcher', 'Kate Harbour'], 'Studio': ['Aardman Animations']}
Love Shaun the Sheep.  He IA always thinking.  He doesn't miss a beat, I hope you will be able to meet, Shaun the Sheep.  I love Shirley and Timmy too
Dont miss a beat, come watch Shaun the Sheep

Ok, I hate it when a great pilot is shown, gets great reviews and isn't picked up.  This is a GREAT  story.  I love the blend of city and country settings, I like the characters, and I want to know what happens to brothers, cousins, and grandparents.  More, more, more please !!
I Want To Know What's Next
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Niall MacCormick'], 'Producers': ['Helen Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
I recently read many of Trollope' s novels and was thrilled to see that a theatrical adaptation was available.  Yes the movie has some slight changes, but it is a great representation of Trollope' s work.  If you have not exposed yourself to his writing, it can be confusing at first, but all is made clear by the conclusion.  The movie was the same.  I felt as if I read the book for a second time.  Excellent
Like Both Book and Movie

Ok, my friend Linda got me hooked on the Harry Bosch novels.  Now she has me hooked on the series.  Can't wait for the next book nor the next season !!
I Could Kick Linda
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Adam Davidson', 'Alex Zakrzewski', 'Sarah Pia Anderson', 'Ernest Dickerson', 'Christine Moore', 'Stephen Gyllenhaal'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Pieter Jan Brugge', 'Daniel Pyne'], 'Starring': ['Titus Welliver', 'Jamie Hector', 'Amy Aquino'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
One of the best detective series available.  Bosch seems approachable but intense.  I enjoy that the Bosch in the novels and in the Amazon series are not exactly alike but very closely related.  Even if my Bosch novel character differs in my mind a bit from the Amazon Bosch, both represent an exceptional excellence in writing.  I don't watch much cable or network television but save my time for reading and Amazon series !!
Bosch Bosch Bosch
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['David Duchovny'], 'Producers': ['Richard B. Lewis', 'Bob Yari', 'Jane Rosenthal'], 'Starring': ['Anton Yelchin', 'Téa Leoni', 'David Duchovny'], 'Studio': ['tribecashortlist']}
As I was watching this film, I was watching through the lives of the actors in real life.  It's touching how through the death in the film, life was lived.  As the actors have subsequently died, divorced, grew, changed, life continues and changes.  If I watched this film after it came out, I would have had a different perspective.  I am glad I ran across it now because it is so appropriate.
In The Light of Their Lives
{'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Pellington'], 'Producers': ["Kirk D'Amico", 'Anne-Marie MacKay', 'Mark Pellington'], 'Starring': ['Shirley MacLaine', 'Amanda Seyfried', 'AnnJewel Lee Dixon'], 'Studio': ['BLEECKER STREET FILMS']}
We all know or have known one older person that seems to a pain in everyone's backside.  You might be that curmudgeon that people are polite, seemingly interested but melt away once your head is turned.  People, even bitchy old people can make a difference.  Listen to what they mean, not just what they say.  And they need to listen to themselves so that they might impart wisdom to the finale.  McClain is superb. Highly recommended.  Warning of foul language but I take that over a non violent, non graphically pictorial of sexual encounters.
Appreciate the Curmudgeon

Good movie.  Love the big with Dr Phil. Love the out take during the credits.  Tyler Perry might be getting tired of playing Madea but I will always love that old fart.
I Love Madea

profile:
User Preferences Summary:

- **Genres**: The user maintains a strong interest in crime dramas and detective series with intricate narratives, alongside a robust appreciation for comedy and drama, particularly in satire and political humor. Recent interactions highlight a growing affinity for character-driven narratives that emphasize human experiences, especially those featuring older characters and intergenerational themes.

- **Tone**: They enjoy narratives that combine humor with serious themes, including politics and morality. A newfound appreciation for light-hearted yet reflective storytelling is evident, with a focus on nuanced character dynamics and relatable villains.

- **Content Sensitivity**: The user is comfortable with mature themes, gravitating towards gritty, thought-provoking narratives that entertain while providing depth. This includes an interest in both animated and mature-oriented family content.

- **Viewing Purpose**: Their engagement reveals a preference for entertainment that mirrors real-world issues, reflecting social commentary that evokes emotions such as tension, humor, and introspection.

- **Engagement Style**: The user's distinct preference for character-driven stories with clever writing and complex arcs continues, now enhanced by an appreciation for narratives surrounding wisdom in human connections. They favor immersive streaming series over traditional cable, with an emerging interest in films that explore the interplay of food, love, and passion for life.

The latest interaction reinforces their taste for uplifting narratives that celebrate love, family, and personal passions, while still acknowledging gritty realities.
